itemDescription: English county circuit judge and legal scholar

wikipedia_page.main: John Thomas Abdy (July 5, 1822 – September 25, 1899) was Regius Professor of Civil Law at Cambridge University.

response: Abdy was born in Cambridge, the son of John Thomas Abdy, Regis Professor of Law at Cambridge and a County Court Judge. He was educated at Charterhouse School and commissioned a lieutenant in the Royal Artillery in 1876.

Abdy was born at Hornsey in May 1860 to Marion Hollway and her husband, John Thomas Abdy. He entered into Britannia Royal Naval College in July 1873."Naval And Military Intelligence."  The Times (London, England), Friday, Jul 04, 1873; pg. 5; Issue 27733. He entered service with the Royal Navy in 1875, with the rank of Midshipman, becoming a Sub Lieutenant in August 1882. He played two first-class cricket matches for the Marylebone Cricket Club at Lord's in 1882. Abdy was placed on the retired naval list in February 1899, and died three months later in May. His brother, Anthony, was also a first-class cricketer.
